column4: I can't even log in dude
I've never even been logged into linux. Ever. In my life. Let alone be able to install drivers.
for a first time linux user.. I"m certainly not seeing linux in a loving light :[
There's a difference between perfection and not working at all
do you know what kind of graphics card you have?
I'm a linux n00b, not a computer n00b ;)

ok, well when X has failed to load you should still be able to get console logins, which will let you fix this if you want to? It could be that the 6600 is too new for the basic nvidia driver included

https://wiki.ubuntu.com/BinaryDriverHowto/Nvidia - read that - the only difference is that you can't use synaptic, so to install nvidia-glx you need to log in to the console and do "sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx"
you can find out by rebooting into recovery mode and running "grep 1000 /etc/passwd" (the first part is the username), then you can reset the password for it with "passwd yourusername"
It'll look like this: cmsj:x:1000:1000:Chris Jones,,,:/home/cmsj:/bin/bash
